Rating Activity Considerations in Claims Alleging a Child’s Permanent Incapacity for Self-Support
Rating determinations will be made under the provisions of
38 CFR 3.356
, which requires the child to be permanently incapable of self-support through their own efforts due to physical or mental disabilities as of their 18th birthday.
The question of permanent incapacity is one of fact for determination by the rating activity based on
competent evidence
of record.
References
:  For more information on
the definition of competent evidence, see
M21-1, Part V, Subpart ii, 1.A.2.c
when to request evidence of permanent incapacity for self-support, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 6.B.2.a
, and
considering the competency of children permanently incapable of self-support, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 6.A.2.c
.
title: M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, Chapter 6, Section B - A Child’s Permanent Incapacity for Self-Support
